admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal purpose of the Railway
            Technical Assistance Project is to assist the Indonesian
            State Railway (PJKA) in efforts to bring about measurable
            and significant improvements in its traffic operations as
            well as in mechanical and track maintenance over the next
            four years.  At the same time, it aims to lay the groundwork
            for a major reorientation of commercial, operational and
            maintenance practices that should enable PJKA to become
            financially viable over a seven- to eight-year period.  To
            that end, the project entails four components.  First, the
            project involves (a) technical assistance to PJKA in the
            following areas:  a comprehensive management information
            system, costing, procurement and inventory control, train
            scheduling, and rationalization of mechanical and track
            maintenance.  Further to this, it provides (b) training of
            railway staff and (c) acquisition of equipment for handling
            containers and intermodal traffic, a few pieces of
            maintenance and miscellaneous equipment, and computer
            hardware and software for a management information system.
            Finally, the project includes (d) minor physical
            improvements, such as paving of yards, to facilitate
            container and intermodal traffic.
